name: inroad
content:
make inroads/an inroad
Add to word list
Add to word list
to start to have a direct and noticeable effect (on something): The government is definitely making inroads into the problem of unemployment. We have not been able to make much of an inroad into the backlog of work.

something that has a noticeable and positive effect on something you are trying to achieve: The deal marks the first major inroad into the country's domestic market.
make inroads in/into sth
to start to have a noticeable and positive effect on something: The grant for a new job-creation scheme should make inroads into the community's unemployment problem. U.S. consumer-goods companies are finally making inroads in this fast-growing market of 45 million people.
